Battleship

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battleship.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    User

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements User
    This class keeps track of all the operations necessary for the player. It randomly sets up the player's ships.
    Version:
    May 30, 2019
    Author:
    Tanav, Period: 5, Assignment: Batttleship_APCSFinalProject, Sources:

      static java.awt.Color[][] playerLocation

    • Field Detail

      • playerLocation

        public static java.awt.Color[][] playerLocation
        A 2D Color array to keep track of where the player's ships are located. If Color at the grid is equal to the gridColor, then nothing is present, otherwise the grid is filled with ship's colors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Constructor. Initializes the color object. In a 2D array sets all the colors to the grid colors.

    • Method Detail

      • setShips

        public void setShips(Ship[] ships)
        This method iterates through the inputed Ship[]. It calls setShips helper with each ship
        Specified by:
        setShips in interface User
        Parameters:
        ships - an array filled with different types of ships.

      • setShipsHelper

        public void setShipsHelper(Ship s)
        This method randomly generates a number between 0 and 1. If the number is 1, the ships are placed horizontally. It generates another random location and if the ships are placed outside the bounds, it will calculate a new location for the ships to be placed at. If 0, it will place ships vertically with the same logic.
        Specified by:
        setShipsHelper in interface User
        Parameters:
        s - The ship to be places
